content.description: Big undercling start hold at waist height, move right to crimps in face, long move to slimper over lip and jump to the slopey ledge. Easy but dirty topout.  Not sure of the grade but it took me many more tries than the egg or illusions.
content.location: 15 feet to the right of illusions of grandeur.

content.description: Start under roof on obvious jug, pull up to slopey feature, try to climb feature to thin crimps to a jug top out
content.location: next problem to the right of Hang line

content.description:
What rating do you call an undercling jug, with schmeary feet, traverse to a couple fun reachy feet right, and back up for lots of fingertips? LMK

 There is room for to progress past this and enjoy more difficult climbing.
content.location: There's an undercling for illusions of grandeur that can be held as you smear feet, making your way as far right as possible, which leads to a couple fun pauses in footwork. Then looking up and left there are small fingers and tips for matching, traversing back.

content.description: A possible line has appeared left of the crack in the hangar. Starting on a solid edge at head height above a pile of choss, begin to work your way through the roof on an interesting mix of compression and laybacking on some crimps and pinches out to the lip into a heinous looking topout. The grade is simply a suggestion assuming it is possible, and is therefore subject to change. Good luck everyone!
content.protection: You'll be needing a crew for this one.
content.location: In the hangar, to the left of the crack by around fifteen feet or so.

content.description: Scramble up easy moves to the obvious roof crack, climb crack out roof 12ft to big move at the lip and few easy moves on the head wall to easy top out
From left to Right, has an incredible edge for flat finger crimps, schmeary feet, some good blade and features to get toes onto. You can make some nice movements.
content.location: Just beyond and still considered The Hanger area to the left, there is a wall of flat rock about face height that has a few artificially drilled marks in it.

content.description: Start matched on waist height undercling (same as No Chomos), move up to the side pull and to the horizontal crack line and follow it left all the way towards the top of Illusions of Grandeur, throw a high heel or some sketchy feet and pull the lip, top out left or right.Seemed like the most proper line for the crack. ASIDE: I am sure you and your grandmother climbed this 40 years ago, but no one has documented it. If anyone has an official line name, I would be happy to change the name and set the FA, until then, this name seemed fitting to the current names on MP. NOTE: Previous holds have been glued on this route. Looks like it has been there for a while.
content.location: Same as No Chomos, large obvious undercling, 15ft to the right of the Hanger proper.

content.description: Start matched on the slimey flat hold at the back of the shoulder high roof. Move out the roof to the large sloping rail. Make a huge move out and right to the textured ledge. Move a little further right and back up left up to finish matched on the massive sandy ledge.New addition to my knowledge in the Hangar area. Big moves between big slimey holds. I can't find any documentation for this problem, so if it needs a name and a grade you can call it "Come on Dude!" V8. Just because Chippewa needs more V8s. I could be off grade in either direction. You should climb it and give your opinion! If it's called/graded something else I'll be happy to edit. Also, I didnt top out the choss pile above, but you can if you'd like and gain the style points. That's fine too.
content.location: At the Hangar area between Arete Threat and Buce Lee.

content.description: Prow at The Hanger with the high stand start (has a sloping rail for the left hand).  Get on, squeeze and make one move to the jug (or bump your hands up through nothing holds).  Top out.

Start between Illusions and the large mobile piece marked with an "x" in chalk on a shelf jug. Move left through a long move or two to the shelf just right of Illusions. Some fun and easy movement leads you straight into the starting moves of Illusions. Someone with any resemblance of endurance could probably rip through this thing in no time, but if you just climb at Brecks, already arriving at the crux with a pump makes things a bit more interesting. Though this climb is pretty arbitrary, it does add something to new to tick off when you're bored of everything else at the creek. Get out there and get after it!
content.protection: Two or three pads is ideal.
content.location: Between the Hangar Crack, and No Chomos.

content.description: The Hanger is tucked up on the north western slope of the valley and offers the steepest most classic roof climbing in the area. The Hanger offers lines ranging from V1-V10+
